Stay somewhere else. The only nice part was the garden in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel close to old town San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Nomaad
Reviews.Content: This is our first stay at the Crown Plaza Mission Valley. We were looking for a hotel close to old town and this fit the bill (Disclaimer: I am a Platinum Priority Club Member). Outwardly this is not a typical Crown Plaza hotel. Itâ€™s an older hotel that is more reminiscent of motel (your room door opens to the great outdoors instead of an inside hallway). But what it lacks in modern appeal they make up for on the service end. Hereâ€™s the Good: Rooms are very clean with modern drapes, bedding and a flat panel TV. We were upgraded to a â€œLeisure Roomâ€� with a nice view of the golf course next door. We stayed there on Halloween night and it was very quiet around our room. No wild parties to note. The hotel theme is Polynesian with waterfalls in the court yard, a super clean pool and plenty of tropical foliage. The sushi bar in the lounge was unexpectedly very good. The staff at the hotel was very friendly. From the front desk to the maids to the restaurant staff, everyone either greeted us with a â€œhelloâ€� or a â€œgood morningâ€�. To me that was important. Usually you donâ€™t get that even at a four star hotel. Now the Bad: The pillows for our bed were very stiff. I did have some trouble getting sleep due to constantly trying to keep my neck comfortable. You are close to Interstate 8 so you will get some of that freeway noise. Also, how about some HDTV to go along with that flat panel you guys paid for? And the Ugly: Not that we needed it but our room AC/Heater did not work at all. My wife wanted to turn on heat in the middle of the night because she was a little chilly but no dice. Also the alarm clock was unplugged from the wall so we plugged it back and set the time ourselves. (Maybe the maid should tip us?) All in all, our stay was pleasant. I wish I knew about the shuttle bus to old town San Diego. I would have taken that instead of driving. My bad for not asking. Next time Iâ€™m in the Mission Valley area again. I would definitely come back. And this time Iâ€™ll use the Pool and the Spa. Note to Reviewers: I read some of the reviews for this hotel and it always cracks me up when I read how people are outraged to find out that they have to pay for parking. The hotelâ€™s own website says you have to pay for parking so why the outrage? Do your research before you checking in so you wonâ€™t be so shocked at the sticker price of staying at Crown Plaza or any other fancy hotel. Also, a reviewer complained about fake Hawaiian feel to the hotel. Well Duh! If you want real Hawaiian feel, Honolulu is a 5 hour flight away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and facilities. Need car or other transport to get anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: jdandjm
Reviews.Content: Location Hotel Circle North. Good for conferences, receptions and seminars. But it is some way to the centre of San Diego, so not the place to be if you want to spend most of your time exploring the city. Close to I8 freeway. To downtown by car is 10 mins. (Cab $15). Bus (No88) then Trolley is $2.25 per person. (About 30 mins.) However the hotel has four shuttle buses which will take you to the Old Town transit station, Fashion Valley shopping mall, zoo and golf club etc. (free) This is a good service but just as well, as there are no shops or other facilities in the hotel circle. Arrival Large covered entry area for cars with porters at the ready for bags. Also large entry foyer. Check-in was fast and no problems. Very helpful staff. We did not use porters as it was smooth rolling all the way to the room. The public areas are decorated in Hawiian style with lush tropical gardens in the atrium and around the pool area. The room Our room was on the top floor (8). The balcony has panoramic views which takes in a green hillside, the freeway, the river and Sea World in the distance. The Good The room itself is quite large with a separate entry area and plush decoration with four large antique prints and a large flower print on the walls. Furniture everywhere including the two QS beds, a monster centre piece housing the TV, fridge, microwave, safe, hanging space and three large drawers. In addition to this we had a mid-sized office desk and a dressing table, both with chairs, a small dining table and two more chairs and drinks table on the balcony. Oh, and I didn't mention the large bedside table and yet another (built-in) robe. Some self-catering facilities, consisting of the fridge, microwave, coffee maker and the small dining table. (You can buy milk, juice etc from the small coffee shop in the mornings.) The beds are very firm but OK, and come with no less than seven pillows each. Internet access via cable, and there is a clock radio with CD player and a coffee maker. The A/C is very effective. An iron and board are also included. Room service. Free newspaper (delivered if requested). Noise at night is very low; just occasional plumbing sounds and corridor shouters. The bathroom is OK size for one person at a time. Lots of towels. Bath and shower, wide bench top and a few extra facilties. Good hot and cold water pressure. Small heater in the ceiling. The Bad No mini-bar. Lighting is OK but no bed-side control. No direct reading or ceiling lights and no light over the dining table or on the balcony. While the TV has a good range of channels and pay-to-view services, it's all in NTSC analog, not digital, so it's a bit fuzzy. Internet is $10 per 24 hours. (No WiFi.) There's only one folding rack for bags. The bathroom has virtually no towel rails, no clothes hooks and no safety grab-rail for the bath/shower. As usual in American hotels, there is no floor drain in the bathroom. (I guess that's the hotel's problem should an accidental flooding occur.) Don't forget, room service menu prices are just the start: add 18% service, 9% tax, $2 delivery then the tip. General faciities. Attractive restaurants and lounge/bar areas. Tiny gift shop. A small take-away coffee shop but only open 5.30am-10.30am. No decent coffee available anywhere at any other time. Nice heated pool and spa area but no toddlers pool. Large parking areas (not free), business centre, fitness centre, laundry and ice and soda machines etc. Wheelchair access most places. On top of all this are large conference/function/meeting rooms located a short distance from the guest rooms. A wedding ceremony took place in the pool gardens.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: mttfriend
Reviews.Content: we are in SD for SMTA meeting for 2 days, and we made a mistake making one rooom reservation instead of 3. and they gave us extra roll out bed for free.. and .. and ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: qtboss911
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the Crown Plaza part of an extended family vacation for our sons graduation from Marine bootcamp. There were 8 in our group. We found the hotel to meet and or exceed our expectations The rooms were clean and spacious. The grounds were well kept as well as the pool and hot tub area. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The parking was better then we anticipated based on previous reviews. Yes $12.00 a day is a bit much and the spots are not very generous but we never had a problem finding spot to park. The location was great and the freeway noise was minimal. Our only complaint would be the 35 cents per minute use of the hotel internet service which we needed for airline boarding passes. We are planning another trip toSan Diego in Feb and will stay at the Crowne Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: LewesBeach
Reviews.Content: Prepare to pay extra for stuff normally provided for free such as parking, room internet service, access to a computer with printer for boarding pass and forget about that free breakfast danish. A simple breakfast will run $10 - $15. Older hotel that's fairly well maintained. I'm spoiled by Hampton Inn's and other business traveler-friendly hotels. Look for other hotels around Hotel Circle North & South.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesey271975
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times over the past few years. Its a great Hotel for the money. Room are big and clean and the Hotel grounds are beautiful. Its a little outside of San Diego but for the price its worth a 10 min drive downtown.

Reviews.Title: “nice,not so nice location”
Reviews.Author: jazEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2 nights to see san diego, the hotel was very nice,lovely room over looking the pool. All amenities you need and more in the room,very lush. the only down side was having to pay for parking and the location of the hotel which was out of the way for places to eat etc, we had to get in the car to find somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The parking here SUCKS!! Dont stay here.”
Reviews.Author: vannievee
Reviews.Content: This hotel appeared nice in the lobby and online but once you got into your room it was a whole other story. The parking was horrible. The spots were made for mini coopers. We have a 4 door sedan and it barely fit in the spots. The SUV's that were parked HAD to take up to 2 spots and the worst part you HAD to pay to park there. The doors to rooms didn't even shut all the way even with the secure lock. It seems like all someone had to do was hold the handle down and give it a good push and you'd be in the room. I didnt feel secure at all. Also the carpet felt very dirty. I didnt feel comfortable walking around with no socks or shoes. The only good part about it was that it was close to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Cindy005
Reviews.Content: Nice stay with husband and two children (11 and 14). The room was larger than expected with 2 Queen beds with changing area next to bathroom. Room had balcony overlooking golf course. Pool area was clean and large enough for all to enjoy (believe it was a salt pool). Food was pricey especially breakfast at Kona Cafe. After first morning, chose to drive to get breakfast and saved $20. Rooms also noisy. You can hear other doors closing, showers and hallway noise. Car is a must but the shuttle is a great option and everyone was extremely willing to help us get to fun places or shuttle us. Close to EVERYTHING San Diego has to offer. Great price (less than $100 per night). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel close to Amusement Parks”
Reviews.Author: jakzw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days, the hotel staff was generally very friendly and helpful with the exception of one irratable waiter. Pros: Good location, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, accessibility to highways. Cons: The parking spots along back wall are too small for anything but a sub-compact, although spots adjoining the building and on the end lots were good. Elevators were noisy and made for poor sleeping on the last night. Pool was heated? If so at a very marginal rate, not cold but definitely not warm enough to call 'heated' Overall I would stay here again but not look to use the amenities very much.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short stay”
Reviews.Author: cornishdragon2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of Coach tour of California.Thought Crowne Plaza was very nice and we had a good room number 1438 looking across pool.The usual facilities were in room e.g.tea/coffee maker etc and TV hairdryer etc.also good selection of toiletries in bathroom.Had one evening meal here which was quite good. However if you want to go out to eat Hunters Steak house is quite close and they do a good well priced dinner with plenty of choice on the menu too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, central location.”
Reviews.Author: Perhillion
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March. We booked through a bid on Priceline ($61 per night + tax), and for that amount, it was a good value. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool area was nice. The first night we stayed in a "pool view room", which puts you very close to the freeway, and the noise comes through the glass doors like you're standing outside. We asked to be moved to the opposite side of the hotel, which they did with no problem. The last two nights were excellent, no problems with noise, beds were comfortable, everything was clean. Parking was $12 per night with in/out privileges, and there wasn't anywhere else to park to avoid these charges. The hotel is close to Fashion Valley Mall and Old Towne San Diego, and close to any other attraction in San Diego. However, you're surrounded by freeways, so you can't really walk anywhere, you generally need to rent a car to get around. Internet was $9.95 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - near sea world”
Reviews.Author: roadtripcanada
Reviews.Content: Great location on hotel circle. Looks like the best hotel on the road. % mins to old town and sea world an the massive plaza. 20 mins to zoo. Friendly staff. Nice restaurant and bar area. Free shuttle. Great deal for the money - old paid $89 per night. Would stay there again. Evelevators were broken. Small pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay here for four nights in early November. If you are thinking of booking this hotel do so through Hotwire - it comes up as a 3.5* - that is the clue. I paid $66 (inclusive) per night and that was a real steal. Sure they get you back by charging $12 for car parking and $10 for the internet but its worth it. The hotel itself is fine. Its laid out round the pool and and another courtyard and is 'motel' type with open corridors to the courtyards. The pool looked a bit small for the size of hotel and the separate spa is inconvenient - but its minor. Overall its not quite up to the normal very high standard of the Crowne Plaza brand but its fine and, at the rate, a real steal. The internet worked well. The small gym is adequate with 2 x-trainers, two joggers and two bikes with a small weight machine. Its clean and the kit is in good condition. The hotel is slightly isolated so its eating on-site or driving. Nothing in walking distance as far as I can tell. The on-site sushi restaurant was fine if a bit pricey and my pasta dish in the main restaurant was surprisingly good. There is a good value coffee and bagels outlet in the morning for those who don't want the full buffet breakfast. To address some of the criticisms in the other reviewers. I personally didn't have the 'battlefield' noise experience of others but it certainly got noticeably noisier over the weekend (with slammed doors and kids running in the corridor) as it filled up - despite being in the quieter rear of the hotel. It worked well as a base for the San Diego area and for the conference downtown (15 mins on the freeway even at peak times) where the going room rate was circa $300 per night. I'd certainly recommend it the hotel and will have no hesitation in re-booking.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza the friendliest place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: Piva19
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Everyone is very friendly, pleasant, even the person who takes the ticket in the parking lot. The beds are the best I have ever stayed at. Overall one of the best places I have ever stayed. Felt like you you on an island, great scenery, shrubs, pool is ok also. Will stay there again when we visit San Diego. Close to all freeways to get downtown, zoo, shopping, beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Ka-boom! The Guns of Navarone would certainly have been sweeter!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinManSMonica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza in San Diego's Mission Valley on Sunday, Aug. 31, 2008 and we will NEVER stay there again! Unlike some of the other reviewers, I felt the rooms were well-decorated - our room had framed floral prints on the walls - the bed was new and the linens were expensive. The carpet had a brown and gold checkered pattern and was new-ish and clean - and, yes, we checked to make CERTAIN the floors/carpets were clean after reading the other reviews. Even more important, the bathrooms were clean as well. There was no mildew in the bath/shower and the shower curtain hangs on a convex rod that keeps it from touching you during a shower. Fine. The vanity and floors were of the same matching tile - heavy, modern stuff. The vanity had two sinks - always a plus for my partner and me - it makes getting out in the mornings much more efficient. The free shower soaps and shampoos were of high quality and the towels were plush enough. The room (Room 1337 BTW) seemed to be recently renovated or was simply well-maintained. Not at all unpleasant. All of the above goes in the "plus" category. However, in the "minus" category: The hotel tries for a faux tropical feel (read: Hawaiian tat) but it is a very sad attempt at a theme that simply does not work. It is filled with poorly done (very perfunctory) water features - tacky, tacky, tacky - and the odd, sad, faded, captive coi that seemed to call out, "Save me, kind sir, for God's sake end my misery." Ugh! One of the elevators was out. Really? On a holiday weekend? The real negative stuff started when we found that the hotel is built on large eight-story high horseshoe shaped courtyard. Not good! Every door that closed - no I got that wrong - EVERY DOOR THAT WAS SLAMMED SHUT and slammed shut EVERY TIME the doors were closed reverberated in our room like a cannon being fired. It was astounding the amount of noise that was generated and the number of booms we heard from these slamming doors - there were hundreds of them! HUNDREDS! Especially on Sunday morning! Yes, many other reviewers mention this fact - but take my word for this - I have NEVER experienced such a cacophony - I kept shouting, "Incoming! and "Take Cover!" Wow! We went to San Diego because we have a season subscription at LaJolla Playhouse. We go to get away from the noise and pace of Los Angeles - not to attempt to relax in the middle of a reenactment of the Civil War. When we went out on the balcony and saw the state of the facilities and were not pleased at all. We were on the third floor overlooking the swimming pool. On either side of our balcony was the top of some sort of supporting structure or perhaps storage units. No matter, they are covered with ugly broken wooden lattices - they must have been new at some point - perhaps back in the early 1990s - now they are broken and junky and should be scrapped. There is trash and TOWELS that have been dropped from the floors above collected in these lattices and it is simply a mess. Ugh - again! It appears that the Management at the Crowne Plaza does only what is required and does not choose to go that little extra distance or put in that little extra effort to make a guest's stay NICE. Isn't NICE the goal? Well it oughta be! It doesn't have to be perfect - just NICE! Now on to the worst aspect of the place. The smoking! We cannot abide smoky hotel rooms and will move to another hotel instead of staying in a room that has been infused with cigarette smoke. One reason we chose the Crowne Plaza was that the entire wing we were in was SUPPOSED to be non-smoking. THAT IS A LAUGH! When we entered the room, I remarked that the place smelled like a hotel room - fresh linen - recently cleaned - you know, like a non-smoking hotel room usually smells - no smoke at all. So far so good. We WERE a bit put off by the "survival kit" that was on the bed when we entered though. Other reviewers have mentioned this "kit" but I will reiterate - it contains three very tell-tale objects. Ear-plugs - oh no! - a sleep mask to cover your eyes - say it ain't so! - and finally a tiny spray bottle of lilac linen freshener - huh? Well, I suppose that the first two items are self-explanatory - too much noise (see the report from the front-lines above) and too much light - although I did not find there was too much light in the room - and there was a drape clip attached to the drape pull that made keeping the light out a snap. (Perhaps this is for people whose closet lights will not go off - as mentioned in other reviews.) But as for the third item (the spray) it was not until late at night that we finally got it. Right in the kisser! Yes, our wing was non-smoking - the floors above us and below were non-smoking - but somebody, somewhere was smoking in that hotel - SEVERAL SOMBODIES IN FACT! Our room filled with noxious cigarette smoke at regular intervals ALL NIGHT LONG and it worsened in the morning when all those smokers somewhere in the Crowne Plaza (AND MY PARTNER AND I) - EVEN THOUGH WE *DON'T* SMOKE!!! - partook of that first cigarette of the day! Jeez! We needed gas masks (to maintain up the battlefield motif of this review.) Why claim non-smoking rooms at all when it is obvious that the air-conditioning or ventilation system is so poorly engineered that is simply sucks all the smoke from other parts of the hotel into your room anyway! THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE and another reason we will NEVER stay at the Crowne Plaza again. And let me assure you that tiny bottle of lilac linen spray is not sufficient to combat the onslaught of smoke. If only that were possible! A few other ideas in response to some of the other reviewers comments. The lights in our lighted closets DID do out when the doors were closed, so we did not have to contend with that. And I agree with some of the other reviewers - the safes are laughably small. About a foot wide and perhaps two inches deep. "Really? Really? Then you try to get your valuables in there!" And I don't travel with many valuables. Ludicrous! I found the staff friendly enough - unlike some of the other reviewers. The parking costs $12.00 for a 24-hour period and had in/out privileges. Pretty standard. The exhaust fan in the bathroom did not draw and the room stayed steamy all morning - why?, why? Why ask why? Towels are provided at pool side. Very good. And there is a separate area for sun-bathers away from the pool itself. VERY GOOD! But I felt the pool was under-chlorinated (dangerous) and it was filled with dead insects - it needed to be skimmed. We got out when someone in the pool suggested it was filled with salt water. It was simply under-chlorinated so it did not seem like most other "public" pools that one experiences! Ugh - a third time! Skip this place if you are able. We got a deal on Hotwire that I feel was not worth it in hindsight. There are so many choices in Mission Valley as well as LaJolla and San Diego and environs - surely there are better hotels that the Crowne Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Great Sushi”
Reviews.Author: janeblaize
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the BEST of the Hotel Circle Properties. The price is right and the staff friendly- It is big enough so you don't feel like you are in a heard of families visiting Sea World. The pool perfect the spa relaxing and clean-But the best suprise was the Sushi Bar in the Hotel Lobby- Big Mike is great and accomodating-the fish fresh and yummy--- Even locals come here. Great experience-

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: MarthaEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from the 8th August until 13th August with another couple whilst we travelled along the west coast. The other hotels that we stayed in were beautiful and we assumed that because of the cost of this hotel and the good name it would be to. The reception area of the hotel was pleasant enough but as we began to walk to our room the hotel deteriorated and began to feel more like a motel. We were place on the ground floor overllooking the car park. Our balcony consisted of a dead cockroach and two minature smashed vodka bottles from a room above. When we firsted entered our room it was so dark that our eyes had to adjust. There are only lamps in the room and they seem to slightly brighten up after about 5 minutes, leaving the room quite dull and gloomy. The room is in need of refurbishment and the bathroom felt dirty. One day I dropped an earring and went down on the floor to look for it not a pleasant experience. The good thing about the room was the large comfortable bed. The wafer thin walls mean that you can hear the people in the next room word for word. One night our friends rang reception at three o'clock in the morning to complain about the gathering of people in the next room having a mini party. Reception said that they had alot of complaints about noise and that they would send security but they never did. After the third phone call they as good as said that they don't deal with noise issues as they are due to thin walls and not people being excessively loud. My husband and his friend used to play a game count to 10 before a door slams. No wonder they provide ear plugs and a sleep kit. The safety deposit box in the room is a joke. It is mounted in the side of the wardrobe and is about 2 1/2" in depth. Infact our friends in the next room called us to look at it because it was so ridiculous, you had to try and pile items on top of each other and slam the door quickly before they fell out. The wardrobe in both our friends room and ours had an interior light working inside, unfortunatly the door in both wardrobes would not close properly at night so the light stayed on. Our friends had wedged a piece of paper in the door everyday when they went out and decided not to hang any clothes in that wardribe as it only contained the safe. Yet everyday when we arrived back at the room the door had been opened and the light was on. Who was looking at the safe? During my stay my perfume bottle managed to go down by a quarter even though only used to squirts of it a night. My husband and I were celebrating our first wedding anniversary during our holiday and I had taken my favourite expensive silk dress to wear on our anniversary . When we left this hotel and were packing I could not find the dress hanging in the wardrobe. My husband assumed that he had already packed it. When we arrived at the next hotel it was not in the suitcase. We spent $46 on phone calls trying to resolve the matter and were told that we would be contacted at our new hotel with their findings. We advised the Sheraton that we were expecting a phone call and were told that they had a messageing service but no message was left and they told us that they had not recieved a phone call from the Crowne Plaza. We are now back in England spending a small fortune on phone calls trying to resolve this matter and a new problem. We booked our holiday through expedia and paid in advance, on our return we found that without our knowledge the hotel charged us for our stay again. After two days of phone calls noone will talk to us about the matter so we are leaving the credit card company to deal with it. Overall we will not be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Feel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Terriergirl
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is a nice surprise on Hotel Circle. It is convenient to everything (except, perhaps a supermarket...). The grounds are beautiful, especially the interior courtyard area. The pool area is also very nice; however, on the Saturday night we were there, a convention group had overtaken the pool area and we felt totally out of place. There was lots of boozing and such going on and it appeared that several first floor rooms along the pool area had been turned into corporate hospitality suites. The room was large, clean and up to date. I had requested a view of the golf course in the rear of the property but was told at check in that it was unavailable, so I had a so-so view of a dirt lot with a sliver of golf course. However, we did enjoy our breakfast (muffins and delicious coffee purchased at the Kona Cafe in the lobby) on our private balcony every morning. This was my third visit to San Diego and I finally found a hotel that I would be happy to return to. While it is true that the property is not spanking new, there was nothing shabby or in need of repair. A good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience; Great Value -- Thumbs Way Up!”
Reviews.Author: KipNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights after Independence Day for about $140/night. No real complaints at all; very satisfied. Arrived very early but a room was available. Spacious, balcony overlooking the pool, quiet. Ethernet access for a fee (I didn't use). Coffeemaker adequately stocked but no mini-bar. Brian the bell captain was a big help; all staff were very friendly. Hotel has a free shuttle to and from Old Town, where you can grab the trolley (commuter rail) into the city. The only negatives, which were minor: one of the two elevators was out of service the entire time; the hot tub was out of service one of the two nights, and the dining (including room service) is a bit on the expensive side for what they offered. The sundry shop was also closed more often than open.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex2000
Reviews.Content: My two sons (11 & 14) stayed here for 5 nights in July. The staff was excellent, they go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. This is a very family oriented hotel, but even though there are a lot of children, there is not much noise. The pool and grounds are pristine. I would wake up early to see the entire staff working to make sure the hotel was neat and clean. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and if I needed extra towels, etc...they were delivered in under 5 minutes. The room service was five star and not once did I meet anyone who was unhappy with their stay. This is not the Ritz, but a family hotel who makes sure you have an enjoyable stay, and the best of accomodations. You cannot go wrong staying here, there is nothing I saw that I could warn against especially the price. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kathleendaily
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are both in our 20s and we absolutely loved this hotel. The room was huge, there was more then enough closet space. The rooms were plush and the bathroom was a perfect size. The grounds were beautiful and the staff was extremely friendly and informative! The location of Hotel Circle is perfect. It is maybe 1 minute to the 8 or the 5, which take you anywhere you want to go! I have already recommended this hotel to multiple people planning to visit San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSD069
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Crowne Plaza for three nights while touring San Diego. While it is an older property, the rooms have been recently updated and are very clean and comfortable. The location is terrific for getting around and seeing the sights. We asked for a room away from the highway and were given one that overlooked a golf course. We had a nice deck which was perfect for cocktail hour. We really liked the fact that the room had a refrigerator and a microwave. Very convenient for having cold drinks available. The hotel has a lovely pool area and a huge spa. The spa was particularly enjoyable after a day of walking the zoo. The staff was great! Really nice and very helpful. While visiting Old Town we ate at Casa Guadalajara. Great margaritas and wonderful, fresh, Mexican food. We would definitely return to the Crowne Plaza, and would recommend it to friends visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Be A Crown Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: Ocboy301
Reviews.Content: I see now why you have to pay up front for this hotel. It is simply not up to the Crown Plaza standards. It is an older property, it is right next to the freeway and with the old windows and single pane sliding doors (ours was off the track) you can hear the cars all night long. The trucks are really noisy. Also, they allow smoking at the pool and spa, have no ashtrays and you can guess the rest, pretty dirty.The pool is not heated and it too is old with not nearly enough lounges for the amount of guests. I would stay at the Hilton close by for the money you spend. A party was going on at 2:30am until 7:00am and the front desk would do nothing. No sleep that night. One of the 2 elevators was not working and had to spend 15 min getting up and down all the time. Not going back, as you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay.”
Reviews.Author: DC272
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here twice during a recent visit to San Diego. We found the hotel very nice and comfortable. It was centrally located in a clean safe area (hotel strip) near the highway junctions. Its not a new hotel but it has been looked after and is in good condition as well as has had some modern upgrades done to it. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable though on our second stay, we did have a problem with a broken bed. I wouldn't hold it against the hotel as it was due to the mattress coming off of the base platform, probably when the room was being made up. The amenities (pool, spa, hot tubs) were very nice and well looked after though we never had time to use them. The only complaints we had is we found the restaurant and room service hours were short. It was a bit annoying to find after a long day sightseeing and wanting either a late dinner or a snack to find the restaurant closed at 9:00pm and room service closing at 10:00pm. If you eat early, no problem. If you eat late, better do it before those times. There is the sushi bar with some non-sushi items on the menu if you are not into sushi, so you can still get a late bite. We did find the service and delivery charges (18%) were on the excessive side for room service but I would guess that's probably standard for the industry. All in all we were happy with our 2 stays there and would recommend the hotel to any visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel ---- But Found a Bed Bug.”
Reviews.Author: lodger29
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent; the room was in fairly good condition, altho the property/ambiance felt a bit old and could use some upgrades. Had no problems with the reception or cleaning staff as both seemed efficient. However, during my stay i had gotten quite a few red, itchy bumps on my arm. On the morning of my checkout, i noticed a tiny bug crawling up the curtain; suspecting it to be a bed bug.i managed to tape bug with clear tape to a piece of paper. The specimen checked out to be a bed bug.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: SEABREEZE1957
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for a work related conference & found the hotel a nice place to stay for business. It is close to the airport (As someone else stated, lots of airline staff stay here.) and easy access to highways, downtown San Diego, Old Town, and Torrey Pines. The US Open was being held the week we were there & the hotel was pretty busy. The front desk personnel were very friendly and accomodating. I was on the first floor, near an elevator but have no complaints about noise. There was a small patio that looked out to a garden area and the pool. The sliding door required some 'work' to get it to close properly, but it wasn't a big deal. The beds (2 queens) were comfortable and the bathroom clean & spacious. The shower was great. The hotel is not brand new, but the grounds were beautiful, pool is nice and you didn't feel as if you were right off the highway. Parking was steep at $10.00 a day & computer access not free. The sushi bar was excellent & they have a good happy hour. Room service was good, food was average. Overall customer service was great. I would recommend this hotel for a centrally located base if visiting the San Diego area if you can get a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Hotel San Diego - Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: landstoffer
Reviews.Content: My wife and two daughters who are 5 and 7 years old stayed for a week at the Crowne Plaza and had an exceptional stay. Clean room, very friendly staff and great pool made for a very enjoyable time. We would go back again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: CharidyLW
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel (since 1997) before it was a Red Lion. It was a Best Western. Then they remodeled and it became Red lion. Now it's a Crowne Plaza. I have never had a bad experience. They sometimes pipe in wonderful Hawaiian type music into the atrium located between two buildings. There are two large Coi Ponds with waterfalls next to a glass elevator. The Sushi Bar in the Lobby is OUTSTANDING! They used to have a drink called the Blue Lagoon.... comes with a pineapple wedge and an Umbrella. The staff is always very friendly and go out of their way to help. The rooms are super clean and I have never had a room that even needed cosmetic work. This hotel is very close to just about everthing! Minutes from Old Town, Gas Lamp Area, Trolley and only 15min from Ocean Beach! I only wish they didn't charge for parking. Seems ridiculous, just have the guard see your room key or parking permit and they wouldn't have to charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LightningFox111
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my partner and his family to San Diego back in May 2007 (we actually flew into Los Angeles and made the long drive to save some money on airfare) and stayed at the Crown Plaza (formerly Red Lion Hanalei Hotel). Although we had a bit of trouble with our room reservations at first (my sister-in-law didnâ€™t get the bedding she specifically requested), they did allow us to check-in early, which was a plus because we were all tired from the long flight (complete with three young nieces who had never flown out of Hawaii before) and a seemingly equally long drive. They also accommodated our request to have three rooms right next to each other, which was nice (though my partner and I had a room just across the way from his two sistersâ€™ rooms instead of next door, but this was just perfectly fine). There were some nice fish tanks in the lobby along with a restaurant/bar, though we never went there. We were all on the ground floor, so we had nice little patios and grassy areas for the kids to run around on. The landscaping was pretty, with nicely kept plant life and some water features in the atrium that our front doors opened out to. Upon our return at the end of the day, the beds were always made, the towels replaced and the toiletries refreshed. The TV was large enough and it caught a variety of channels (not all of them, mind you), the desk was large (although we didnâ€™t really use it) and the blackout drapes were a nice touch (they did cause a surprise late awakening on our first night, but of course this was our fault). The king size bed was wonderfully comfortable with plenty of pillows and the linens were crisp and clean (no strange stains here whatsoever â€“ believe me, I looked). The bathroom was spotless and smelled quite fresh everyday - a MUST for someone like me with such a sensitive sense of smell (particularly when dealing with OFFENSIVE smells). The guest use ice machine in the hall was important for us since we had so many kids that constantly wanted cold drinks, though none of our rooms had a refrigerator; the hotel should consider adding one as an amenity, if they havenâ€™t already (at least a small one would be nice). My partner and the husbands spent a lazy afternoon at the pool near the end of our stay. The water was cool and refreshing and it was quite large, but not all that deep. The neighboring hot tub was also nice. There was a control right at the waterâ€™s edge where you could adjust the settings. Towels were conveniently provided on a nearby cart. They were actually quite large and fluffy compared to the bath towels, so we ended up taking some to our rooms (though Iâ€™m not sure if this was truly allowed or not). There was a fitness center just above the hot tub, but we never found time to use it. The location is actually really great and we chose the Crown Plaza mainly for that reason. We could drive to Sea World (which was a blast), San Diego Zoo and the San Diego Wild Animal Park. I personally would recommend the Zoo over the Wild Animal Park, but I suppose itâ€™s a matter of preferences (if you donâ€™t mind walking, the Zoo is a HUGE place to explore with terrific exhibits and so many wonderful animals â€“ I truly recommend it). Parking at the hotel was about $10 a day (I think â€“ I didnâ€™t drive the vans) and there was a lot of it on the property. All in all, our stay at the Crown Plaza was a good experience and was a great home base for the first part of our Californian adventure. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrippinmom
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton Homewood Suites was a tough act to follow, and I was, as such, a bit disappointed with the Crown Plaza. My first impression was one of excitement at the lush Hawaiian-style landscaping, including fountains and palms and even Koi ponds, the hotel's main saving grace. I congratulated myself again on using Tripadvisor to pick another winner! I really appreciated the courtesy of an early check-in which was graciously allowed. My room was ample in size, with two queen beds. The lack of refrigerator was my first disappointment. On the other hand, the presence of an in-room safe was another plus. The view from my balcony of a pretty courtyard and sparkling pool was another tick in the plus column. Then again, my room had an unsettling, persistent mildly foul smell--like rotting cabbage. I suspect gasses coming from the plumbing, though my carpet was not exactly new, either, matching the worn, but functional armoire. Who knows? I could detect efforts made toward modernization, such as granite counters in the bathroom, but then again the well-aged bathroom door was either warped from humidity, or painted one too many times, and it had a sticking problem necessitating use of some force to close or open it. That one detail made a big impression on me--of disappointment. The wall separating the toilet from the shower had been patched, and the baseboard tile capping the end of it clung for dear life--with a nice tuft of someone's hairs caught in the cracked grout. Oh, well, only for one night, I rationalized. I did a number of loads of laundry in the well-appoined laundry room next to the spa. I could not work out in the exercise room due to the overwhelming vapors coming from the rubber floor tiles, however. I was quite surprised, and not in a good way, that internet service at this not-inexpensive older hotel was fee-based! You could PAY to use one of the hotel's computers.... Every other (much newer and more modern) hotel I stayed in on this trip had FREE internet access. I did notice many airline personnel leaving the hotel, so I suspect one or more airlines has a contract here--seemingly a plus. The parking lot did not feel safe to me--the rear lot was closely bordered by an area of vegetation. I parked next to the attendant's kiosk instead and walked a little farther to my room. There is no restriction on access to the hotel interior--no locked corridors, and I did wonder about the presence of one unshirted man who visited the laundry room bathroom. Breakfast was not included in my stay. I think with some improvements this hotel could be fabulous, as the layout is quite nice. It's obvious that attempts are being made. I did like the beds--queens instead of doubles, with nice comforters. I found the Koi ponds and fountains and retro-style tiki decor very, very charming and fun for the kids, and this was a big, big plus for me. I hated the cheap floor tiles used all over the outdoor areas of the hotels, however--perhaps someone would do well to contract the services of an architect or landscape designer to preserve the unique charm of this hotel rather than make clumsy attempts to modernize it--just my bias. On the other hand, my children really liked the hotel a lot. On balance, I'm glad I had a night here, but I don't think, without a substantial discount or lack of other choices, I'll be back. I've just had better stays in nicer, safer-feeling, cleaner-feeling hotels for less per-night and nickel-and-diming costs.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: quartztashia
Reviews.Content: I absolutey positively LOVED the Crowne Plaza in Mission Valley. It's going to be hard to compete. It will be hard to satisfy me with other hotels now. The rooms were perfect sized, CLEAN,...just awesome! Mini fridge! I loved the bellmen...they were allowed to give guests rides with the courtesy van so far but some of them would bring us downtown and stuff! They were awesome! The balcony rocked my world! Long length mirrors! Huge bathrooms with two sinks! There was a total of like 4 tables in the room altogether, which was very convienient. A desk with a chair, another table with two chairs (great for mixing drinks!), a nightstand, and even a little glass table with two chairs on the balcony! Got to sit outside and drink with friends after bar close! It was ideal! I LOVED it. Housekeeping came everyday. One night the room key got deactivated because of my cellphone and there was no trouble getting back into my room. The hallways are outside! It was just paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms pretty good, property was definitely not up to Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: mogulman
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for this hotel on Hotwire. I was thinking it was great anyway, since this was a Crowne Plaza. The problem was that this complex was kind of older. The interior rooms were pretty nice with the exception of the older style 20" TV. Beds were comfortable. We came here with my wife and 6 year old son. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The rooms are set up Motor Lodge or motel style though. They all open to the outside. The property is older. The lobby is nicer, but there is no business center. Just a couple of PCs in the Lobby. No concierge. I didn't eat at the sushi restaurant. We did eat breakfast there one day. The buffet was overpriced and not very inviting. It looks like standard free buffets at other hotels. The regular menu was a little pricy for breakfast. The food wasn't too good. Service was awful at the restaurant. The grounds were kind of interesting with some waterfalls Room cleaning wasn't great. I noticed that counter wasn't cleaned the next day after my son had a cup of juice on it. I pre-paid this on hotwire thinking it was a 3.5 star hotel. I would have rated it more of a 2 or 2.5 star hotel. Parking was $10/night. For the type of hotel and area, I think it should have been free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: franklins
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay. The bellmen were OUTSTANDING! Always very helpful and eager to please. The free area shuttle is priceless and the bellmen are very knowledgable about the area. The hotel was nice and clean. Excellent housekeeping service. They are numerous waterfalls and fish ponds on the property. Also, alot of beautiful flowers and greenery.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean”
Reviews.Author: MDK38
Reviews.Content: Our family of four booked two adjoining rooms w/breakfast package. Clean, good service, very spacious and a very attractive property. Definately would recommend and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms!”
Reviews.Author: delectable
Reviews.Content: It doesn't look very special from the outside and lacks a bit of charm in places, but I think that's to be expected from a chain hotel. The rooms were lovely - spacious, clean, very comfortable and some nice touches. The restaurant and bar were very nice too with really good food, a hawaaiian feel and great service - breakfast and dinner, and you might as well eat in as there isn't much else nearby unless you head into the Gaslamp Quarter which has a fabulous selection of restaurants and bars, catering for all tastes so definitely worth the trip. It isn't too far away, just not walking distance. If you do stay in, the bar offers good cocktails but if you look anywhere under 40 be prepared to be asked for ID, and they'll want passports as apparantely driving licenses are easy to fake in nearby Mexico! (Note: if anyone tries to persuade you to go to Tijuana in Mexico - it took us hours to get there, we walked down one street full of tat, ate the worst food I have ever tasted and then took hours to get back - personally I wouldn't recommend it, other than to say you went to Mexico!) The hotel shop wasn't up to much, it was about the size of a box and usuallly closed, but the heated pool and jacuzzi were pleasant - even in November! Plenty of parking but you do have to pay $10 per night to do so which I wouldn't really expect if you were a paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice, clean property”
Reviews.Author: goo0325
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while exploring San Diego and this was a good base. (Convenient to I-5 and I-8 and the 301) Room was nice and recently renovated. There are still renovations going on, but it does not inconvenience any guests. Balcony was nice. Furnishings and bath were of nice quality. Property is like a mini resort with a Polynesian theme. Staff was friendly and helpful. Property was very clean. I will stay here again the next time I am in ther area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Choice”
Reviews.Author: Two_Kids_and_Pug
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for a nice looking hotel that would get us fairly close to Sea World for our family trip without having to pay a fortune. I have to say, the hotel was the only thing that worked out. (Don't take an 18 month old to Sea World.) I was so impressed with the room, the kind and informative staff. I asked about the pre-reserved crib when I was checking in and it was delivered to the room before we arrived there. Every room has a pool view. Beds were incredible. (I bought a new mattress when we returned home because of this.) It was truly a wonderful stay. The hotel was newly renovated. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: rdombro
Reviews.Content: Be aware, my car was burglarized over night while at this hotel. There are no security cameras facing the main parking area and the rare occasions that I saw guards, they were chatting in the hotel lobby, not patroling the parking lot. After a prolonged run around, the hotel's insurance carrier claimed no responsibility and dumped my case in the hands of the owner of the parking lot, who in turn claimed no responsibiltiy and dared me to sue to recover the cost of my property, (golf clubs and GPS) saying "Many people have tried and no one has won". I was hosting a 10 day international conference for 30 guests at this hotel at the time. I certainly was not satisfied with the way my case was handled by the hotel staff and their insurance company. With this type of protection and concern for their customers, I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for an overnight/weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Bramblerose
Reviews.Content: We were going to an event in San Diego and spent one night at Crowne Plaza. Check in was okay, staff was very friendly, polite and helpful. Knowing it was right next to the I-8 I requested a "quiet" room. We were given a room next to the atrium area on the first floor. There are huge tropical trees and plants, several seating areas and a waterfall. The sound of the waterfall was very pleasant but not overwhelming. The decor in the room was lovely and it was very clean. The carpet looked a little tired, but not bad. We had a very nice patio area, more spacious than other hotels I've stayed at. My one complaint would be that there was a family staying in the room next door with 2 or 3 kids who were very noisy and constantly slamming the door. This was surprising to me since I asked for a quiet area but fortunately we were out most of the evening and it was quiet when we returned. We didn't even use the sleep cd or earplugs and had no trouble sleeping. The bed was quite comfortable. We had dinner and breakfast in The Islands restaurant. Dinner was very good, nice sized portions and reasonably priced. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning which was good, but not great. I think a regular breakfast would have been the better choice. The wait staff in the restaurant were attentive, friendly and helpful. No complaints whatsoever. This hotel has a conference center so keep this in mind if you book a room here. The pool area seemed to be very busy as it was being used as a staging area for a group. Also the parking lot is a pain, not worth the $10/day charge, and it was hard to find parking close to our room. I have a feeling other people are allowed to use the parking lot because I'm pretty sure the hotel wasn't full. Also, the number of our room was very close to the number for the front desk, so within one hour of checking in we had 3 phone calls for the front desk. I spoke to the person at the front desk and asked them to put a "do not disturb" on our phone and she seemed surprised we were getting these calls but was very gracious and apologetic. We did have 3 messages later that evening, all misdialed and for the front desk, but as long as the phone didn't actually ring it didn't bother us. Overall, for a quick overnight stay it was pleasant enough, but I wouldn't recommend taking a vacation there.

Reviews.Title: “good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: Venturagal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with our 2 and 4 year old first off (yikes) for a two night stay in San Diego. We asked for two queen beds which we were given. Upon arrival we asked if we could upgrade to a suite so that the little girls could have their own space, but the hotel did not have upgrades (this was fine, it was a weekend and we understand). The room itself was "ok", with pretty decor. Very cramped for a family of four, but woud have been fine for two people. We had a pool view which was nice and the patio is spacious (we were on the 5th floor). We did not use the pool, but it looked well kept and pretty. The bathrooms need a remodel (tub was cracked, floor was very tired looking, tiny). Here is the good: 1) It is in "hotel circle", which means that you are in a cricle with dozens of hotels and close to all of the attractions (Seaworld, etc). You are also right off the freeway, so it is noisy and bustling. The hotel provides you with several amenities for this reason (CD to help you sleep, sleeping linen spray, eye covers, etc). 2) I thought the food room service was excellent. We ordered it twice and both times, the food was really good and the service was speedy(what a plus for two little kids) 3) The black out curtains are awesome and it stays so dark in that room that my kids actually slept in b/c of that until 8am (unheard of). 4) There are lots of movie channels and movies on demand which we like for us and the kids. Here is the bad (which was really bad for me): 1)Cleaning room service never came. We stayed for two nights. After ordering food room service, giving two little kids baths, etc our room and bathroom was in desparate need of housecleaning (especially with how small the rooms are). I was beyond disappointed when i came back to the hotel at 4pm to find a messy room (after being with two little kids at Legoland all day). We had been gone since 9 am! We called down to front and the manager said that housecleaning was gone for the day and they had not gotten around to cleaning our room. My husband said this was unacceptable and that we have small children and that we need a clean room (not to mention towels). The manager said that he would find someone to clean it within 2 hours. So, we left (again after a full day at Legoland already) and came back in two hours to find a room that was cleaned to about 80% cleanliness (we took what we could get) 2) The bedding linens and bathroom towels are unacceptable in my opinion (gosh- Crowne Plaza spring for some nice linens). I have never, ever felt such rough and cheap bedding(even in 1 star hotels). I thought maybe it was me, but my husband and 4 year old complained the next morning as well and said that the bedding felt like "sleeping on towels". He was so right! We actually went to a local Target and bought some blankets to use for our second night! Talk about desparate, huh. I do not think that i will stay here again and with all of the choices that you have on hotel circle, you can probably pick a better one. Again, there were some positives which may outweigh my negatives for you?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great tropical feeling, plus comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: RedlandsRedhead
Reviews.Content: This was my 11th stay at the Crowne Plaza San Diego (a.k.a. Hanalei). I stayed for one night as part of a weekend getaway and attended their annual summer luau. I was staying alone but meeting my sister, who lives in San Diego, at the hotel. We attended the luau together and we both used the room, although only I slept in it. Check in was polite, friendly, and welcoming. Just what I needed after a day of sightseeing. I e-mailed the hotel management before my stay with my room requests to make sure there were no problems upon check in. The front desk clerk, who was very professional, informed me with a smile that my room had been specifically selected and held aside for me by the hotel manager. I appreciated the extra service extended to a repeat visitor such as myself and, since I was traveling alone, it was a relief to feel well looked after. I suggest that anyone with a special room request put in the little extra effort to e-mail or call management before your stay. The nicest views are below the fourth floor in the atrium building with a view of the pool. My room was simply wonderful. The location of the room fit what I requested just perfectly. I stayed in the atrium on the third floor with a pool view. When I walked out the door I could see koi ponds in the garden area below. When sitting on the bed I had a pretty view of palm trees. The main attraction of the nicely furnished room was the bed. It was beautifully made up, with more pillows than I have ever seen on a hotel bed. Upon entering the room I found on the bed a pretty little gift bag, something that each guest receives, with a small bottle of lavender and earplugs to help me sleep, also a â€œSleep Advantage CDâ€�, with soft music that was so perfect for winding down before bed. I even got to keep my Sleep CD at the end of my stay. One of the tables near the bed has a CD player/alarm clock. Before going to bed I took a bath and listened to my Sleep CD. It was so relaxing that I almost felt like I was in a spa! The perfect bathroom accessory to go along with the Crowne Plazaâ€™s â€œsleep systemâ€� would be a bath pillow. The tub is a little short and a bath pillow would be nice to rest your head on. I always take a couple of candles with me when I travel and this room was the perfect setting for relaxing with my candles. The bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. I didnâ€™t want to get out of it! In the morning I listened to a CD of Hawaiian music that I had brought with me. It complemented the tropical feeling of the hotel and I just loved having a CD player in my hotel room to play my music. Nice upgrades were made to the guestrooms and bathrooms when this hotel changed from the Red Lion brand to a Crowne Plaza hotel a few months ago. Besides the new beds, the carpets are brand new. The bathroom countertop has a pretty brown marbleized look. New light accents add a touch of class. There is also a swing out make up mirror with a magnifying side and, of course, a hairdryer. The only thing I would have changed in my room is the location of the writing desk, but I canâ€™t see where else it would have gone. Itâ€™s close to the bathroom, which is near the entry door. That means the desk chair, which is beautiful and comfy, is kind of in the way as you are entering the room. It didnâ€™t bother me at all, though. I didnâ€™t need it and simply moved the chair to the other side of the room and grouped it with another chair where it seemed to fit just fine. There was no published time for when the hotel restaurant, The Islands, stops serving breakfast so I called down to ask. Turns out that I was calling five minutes prior to the end of breakfast (11 a.m.). The restaurant host told me since there was only one in my party he would allow me to order breakfast if I got there right away. I thought that was awesome guest relations and I appreciated it so much. Breakfast was very good. Service was fast and courteous. The Islands restaurant was recently remodeled and I was a little leery about seeing the changes because I loved it the way it was in the past. My opinion is this remodel is a big improvement, although it was somewhat more romantic before when it was dark and cozy. The restaurant now is open and inviting. It has a great view overlooking the pool and palms. To get the same view in the past, guests needed to sit on the patio where seating is limited. Now the patio is adjunct to the restaurant and the large windows actually open up to let in air flow. A little breeze and you truly feel as though you are in the islands. Sitting just about anywhere near the windows will give you a view of a pretty little waterfall. Each table has a small clipping of a Hawaiian flower and the wood used for the tables is just beautiful. My dinner at the hotel was the pre-paid ($59) summer luau, an annual event usually occurring in August or July that takes place on the lawn of the hotel. The food was totally awesome, very tasty and inventive, and the servers were personable and helpful. The Polynesian revue and pre-diner music is professional and authentic. I especially recommend a stay at the Crowne Plaza San Diego during the annual summer luau. The parking lot is not as bad as another review has made it sound. I usually park just a little further out because most guests are always going to want the prime spots in the middle of the lot. When I return, the same space or one nearby is open. I have never had occasion to come upon workmen or transients in this secured lot, whether parking on the west side or east side. The Crowne Plaza is centrally located by freeway to many places in San Diego. Additionally, there is complimentary shuttle that will take you to Sea World and Old Town. On my trip I visited downtown San Diego, Coronado Island, and Balboa Park. The Crowne Plaza San Diego (Hanalei) will remain my favorite hotel in San Diego. I truly believe that it is better than ever and this stay convinced me that hotel management definitely desires to please their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jruthg
Reviews.Content: A seven-night stay in the San Diego Crowne Plaza (Mission Valley), formerly the Hanalai, was less than satisfactory, despite the hotelâ€™s recent (and evidently ongoing) extensive renovations. While my room was clean, comfortable (mostly), and quiet, the nightly struggle to find ANY legitimate place to parkâ€”within a reasonable, safe distance from my room (far east end of the complex),â€”cast a pall over the entire experience. At this point, it is only fair to note that management didâ€”largely--attempt to alleviate my difficulty, and they did admit that they are aware of the parking issues. During my stay those issues included employee vehicles occupying guest spaces, construction materials taking up spaces, large vehicles (e.g., SUVs) taking two spaces, and (according to some staff members) multiple vehicles per room. The hotel charges ten dollars per day for parking. I believe that, when a hotel charges for parking, there is an implied agreement that the proprietor will take reasonable steps to ensure that a sufficient number of suitable, safe spaces will be available per accommodation unit. Otherwise, a daily fee is nothing more than a charge to â€œhunt.â€� Further, when one is travelingâ€”for whatever reasonâ€”the last thing anyone wants to worry about is returning to an accommodation by some â€œmagicâ€� hour in order to safely and legally stow a vehicle. Someone also needs to deal with the fellow (homeless?) who sleeps in the northeast corner of the parking lot, adjacent to a field. One â€œquick fixâ€� that easily could be instituted is for the hotel to require complete vehicle information upon check in. Despite a form that includes space for a license plate number, the only information gathered (from me, at least) was make and color (I had a white, fleet rental car!). Armed with license plate numbers, management could contact owners of vehicles occupying multiple spaces and require that they be reparked properly. Further, I have recently stayed in a property (in another state) that limits each room to a single vehicle by activating (ONLY) one room keycard to work in the parking lot access gate. Even if a guest handed the card to a second driver, the electronic system would record that action and management could take appropriate action to ensure that other guests with vehicles were not disenfranchised. Management also could have insisted that renovation contractors store materials away from the parking lot. One night manager who assisted me started to tell me that using the lot was â€œmore convenientâ€� for the contractors. I responded that contractor convenience should not supersede that of a paying guest. Two other issues arose during my stay. The first concerned the air conditioning unit, whichâ€” during my first hour in the roomâ€”was obviously laboring and not cooling/dehumidifying. The staff attended to the unit immediately and I had no further issue with room temperature. The second matter was far more serious: upon returning to my room on the final night, I approached the door, keycard in hand, and realized immediately that, while the door was shut, it was not latched/locked. After ascertaining that no one was in the room (I had a nearly clear view from the door), I entered and called the desk. They ran an electronic trace to determine the person(s) to last access the room. Not surprisingly, it was housekeeping staff. None of my property was disturbed: any valuables were either with me or in the small in-room safe. As a woman who often travels alone, I am acutely aware of situations that pose potential negative safety consequences. In this case, the combination of an unsecured room and the nightly parking issue, left me with a strong sense of â€œno confidenceâ€� for this hotelâ€”as it is currently. Throughout all the trials encountered, however, I was impressedâ€”for the most partâ€”by the attitude of the staff. Almost uniformly, they were sympathetic and attempted to remedy what they could. Unfortunately, the overwhelming parking dilemma is not something that can be rectified immediately. Some of the younger staff (night shift) tended to repeat, â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€� too many times. Once is enough, and repetition does not fix the situation. Would I stay here again? The Crowne Plaza (Hanalai) is a physically pretty hotelâ€”lush plantings in courtyards, etc., and nicely decorated public spaces. It is not, however, my first choice for San Diego accommodation: My preferred sites were booked by the time I made plans for this trip (dates predicated upon a professional meeting). I certainly would want to know of major progress toward fixing the parking issue, but would consider trying the SD Crowne Plaza againâ€”in a year or two.

Reviews.Title: “No the typical Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: toojays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Hotel Circle by I-8, the traffic in front of the hotel can be pretty bad depend on the traffic come on and off of the freeway. There is stop sign that could cause the back ups. Hotel shows some age, I had a room facing the pool (patio) and the room door open to the inside garden. the room was clean, bed was comfy. no pool noise. And if you next door neighbour slam the door, you will hear it. Parking was very tight + $10 a day and there is a charge for wired interet connection, I don't know if they provide wireless. Hotel Circle is not a pretty area but it ver close to 2 malls and all kinds of restaurants, we get supplies from Target everyday. I only stayed for one night because other hotel s were full, not sure I will come back if I am in the area. I spent the next 4 nights in Days Inn down the road and paid less, free parking and wireless internet. Please see review for that hotel. Also I stayed in Holiday Inn Express in Dana Point for 2 nights, see review on that hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “This Is A Crown Plaza”
Reviews.Author: pilot62
Reviews.Content: This is no where near the standard of the Crown Plaza brand. There was a large group here this week, but 35 minutes to check in is too much. Over 15 min to get out of the parking lot! The rooms by the freeway are small and noisy, staff talking outside your room every morning which is 5 feet from the bed, and all single pane windows. Yes it has the great beds, but for 189.00 plus 15.00 fro parking forget it. As a Platinum Memeber there are no perks at all. Try the Double Tree Club or even the Holiday Inn down the street. Until this staff wakes up about service and remembers that some people sleep at hotels This place is on my NO GO list . Good Hunting!

Reviews.Title: “Don't try to save money staying at this hotel, it's not worth!”
Reviews.Author: 5sunseekers
Reviews.Content: Do not reccomend this hotel, going back to SD and staying at the Marriot Marina. We are not picky or arrogant, actually we are very flexible and travelled. Don't try to save money staying at this hotel, it's not worth! Nightmare started at check-in: Very unfriendly staff, Unable to early check-in or switch rooms even paying more. Front desk acted as they're making us a favor to have us there. Restaurant staff was as bad as front desk and cleanning staff. Hotel does have a nice hawaiian feel downstairs, but room carpert was filthy, yes, we did have a dog, but house broken. We tried to make the most of our days in SD and chose to not request anything else just to not have to see hotel staff. Request extra shampoo or towels is a problem to hand out in there even if you book a room for 5 housecleanning go to the room to make sure we need extra towels. We actually had fun, but unfortunately we did have to interact w/ hotel staff at check out. At this time we tried to let them know elevator was acting out (door closed when we're still going in) and almost killed our dog because my son had the leash inside the elevator while the dog was out. Luckly I was out and snapped the leash when I saw the dog being pushed. They didn't care, they said it was working properly, we just replied that it could happen to a child. We were very happy to leave and have an early check-in at Sheraton Universal, in a clean room by the pool and excellent staff, including the bell hoper. There is a reason to pay more, not only confort, but professional staff willing to make your stay fun. Almost forgot, very bad location, between freeways, no view or walking around. A waste of time and money!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - worth the $”
Reviews.Author: Lyoness
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion on September 11 & 12, 2006. This is a very nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay although we did not spend a lot of time at the hotel. The room was very nice, and clean although it seemed small since the furnture in the room was quite big (this was a king room). We had a room which faced the pool which was a nice view. The only thing we didn't like was the daily parking fee to park the car (it was $20 or 25/day) but every hotel in the area seemed to charge for parking. On a side note the SD Zoo and Balboa Park are wonderful! Also the Midway is a fun adventure to do while in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Stefkaa
Reviews.Content: When I travel to the US from London for conferences I like to book in a few days in advace to adjust to the climate, especially if there is warm weather involved. The Red Lion did not disappoint. The staff was incredibly friendly and the hotel, admittedly a bit dated in decor, was clean. My room was a bit dark (and my bed took up most of it) but it was pretty much on par with what I needed and expected. I loved the Hawaii theme, especially since I had just been there the year previous. It was a bit too cool for me to use the pool (although others were) but I enjoyed using the gym. There were lots of families, but not a lot of noise. The restaurants were nothing to write home about, but a good deal when you're hungry and jet lagged (and had super nice staff). I was aslo able to book a bus tour of San Diego (which was really hilarious and fun) through the hotel. My only complaint is that the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. If you can't drive, you'll be paying for expensive taxis since walking is out of the question. But if you have a set of wheels and you don't mind not staying at a Hilton, this is definitely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay for a 3-star”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_77
Reviews.Content: Got put at the Red Lion thru Priceline. I wanted Hotel Circle in Mission Valley, so location was prime and easy to get to from the airport. The personnel was average friendliness. The lady that first checked me in was not all that helpful (but I got there early, before check-in, so that could have been what frustrated her). I noticed they had a sushi bar, so went up to the guy behind the bar and he said they weren't open. Oh yeah, that figures, as it was only 12:30 in the afternoon. There was loud, noisy, construction, going on in that eating area anyway, so it would have not been pleasant. So I opted for a restaurant inside and they had great food except it was freezing in there. Rooms were nice - the beds were ok - I slept like a baby. But speaking of babies, there was one crying all morning in the room next to me. The baby must have cried for a couple hours, which made for a not so great day to sleep in. They have Bath and Body Works lotions and hair products, I was happy about that. They also allowed me a late checkout on my final day there which was nice. Parking is $10/day. Might be typical for that area though. So tally that in when booking as an additional part of the night there.

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion now Crown Plaza a savior...”
Reviews.Author: MarcusRap
Reviews.Content: Originally booked at "The Dolphin Motel" near Point Loma and my wife and I thought we were in for a horrible vacation. Thank God for the Red Lion and the friendly staff at The Dolphin. We were able to get out of our 5 night stay at The Dolphin, because the owner undertstood we were looking for a little more... Red Lion 1. Good Location 2. Great Grounds 3. Excellent Food (a little expensive) 4. Clean and big rooms with great views (Pool or Golf Course) 5. Nice pool & spa; sub-par fitness center 6. Affordable- $100-$150 /night depending on season and length of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and so did my kids”
Reviews.Author: Wantabeworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I researched my options to the inth degree. Funny, this wasn't one that I was considering, but late in my research, I found it and booked because of the rates and I thought it sounded like fun. What an understatement! Koi ponds, waterfalls, glass elevators, lush greenery and a nice, newly remodeled room too boot. We had an awesome time and will definately return soon. P.S. the staff was very friendly and helpful. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty impressed”
Reviews.Author: vannh
Reviews.Content: I tend to over research hotels and was quite worried when I read some of the reviews from other travel websites. However, Hanalei had pretty decent prices and from checked in to check out, I had no problems. I booked a room for me and my family, and I booked a room for my sister and her family for 3 nights. We were all quite impressed with the place- compared to the other surrounding hotels in Hotel Circle. Its very well kept and the waterfall and koi ponds are beautiful. The kids seemed to really like the place. Other than the sliding door being jammed and the bathroom door knob being loose, I think this hotel is definitely a pretty nice place to stay. My brother stayed at a 4 or 5 star hotel across the freeway for double the cost, but hey, for the price and location I'd definitely stay at the Red Lion Hanalei again. If anything, they need more vending machines. On the floor I was on, they only had a soda machine next to the Ice and being that I'm a snacker with little kids, they definitely would of made more money off of me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Amenities, Lush Landscaping”
Reviews.Author: ArtapQuebec
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Red Lion was a pleasant surprise. The room was cozy and I enjoyed having a microwave and fridge for restaurant leftovers since we stayed for 1 week and for drinks. My family and I took advantage of the shuttle services to the mall and trolley station in Old Town. If you want to go to the North Coast, you can hop on the Coaster for $5 one way and beat traffic...that is a beautiful ride especially when you see Torrey Pines beach. The main restaurant downstairs had good Kona coffee and desserts. They just renovated the sushi bar and outdoor lighting and exterior paint. You can see they are trying to make the effort to maintain the establishment. Someone was having a fun wedding in the middle courtyard one night. My 3-year-old loved the koi ponds and waterfalls..they are gorgeous. There is a laundry room which came in handy at the end of the trip. The Bath and Body Works toiletries were very nice..better than the generic stuff you normally get. Most of the staff were very friendly and accommodating..all but the front desk staff. I'm thinking that since it's such a big hotel, they are tired of their jobs so it is difficult for them to be jovial. However, being as that the front desk personnel are the first impressions one would have of the hotel, it would be a definite plus for many of them to work on their hospitality. A lot of people work hard to make it to San Diego and take a vacation, so it's nice when you are greeted in a classy manner rather than just a number. I would give it 5 dots, but I've seen impeccable hotels so I save my 5 dots for those. The Red Lion has a lot to offer, and as a mother, I think it's wonderful for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: WaiohinuLawaia
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and roomy and the Bed Bath and Beyond soap and shampoo were nice touches. MOST of the hotel staff were very nice and helpful, the restaurant staff was very nice and attentive. The hotel was a bit outdated, and i felt charged way too much for what they had to offer. The worst part of the experience was the front lobby staff. I was there to attend a Government conference nearby and my reservation had been booked by months in advance using the Citys credit card. When I arrived at 9pm, I was told that the credit card had not been charged and thus my reservation had not been paid for. I had to pay $160 cash for the night. The next morning when I went back to the Front Desk to have the citys credit card charged, they told me that they could not process it and I had to put it on my credit card. As I was waiting there, I overheard other customers who happened to be there for the same conference and they all had the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kapilms
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the new year's weekend and found that this HUGE hotel was amazingly reasonable . . . and it's this way year round.
