In the heart of Hotel Circle, this red lion has a tacky Hawaiin feel but it does so with some class - if that makes any sense. My wife and I loved the service, parking with in/out privilages, and got the best bang for our buck. Cab rides to/from the Gaslamp were easy as were rides to/from La Jolla and other seaside locales. Also close to mission bay and sea world. No complaints for a hotel of its class. SD can be a pricey place to visit so this will always be on our booking list. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gatorjmh
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion is a really good property that has been maintained well over the years. It is a Hawaiian theme with lush landscaping. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and sufficiently decorated. Nothing fancy, but very comfortable. We ate breakfast in the restaurant on site. (I believe it was called The Peacock) We had the buffett and it was pretty good. The staff was attentative and friendly here as well. Overall, it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it were better”
Reviews.Author: Samantha_Marie
Reviews.Content: 1. I looked online the night before we went, and there was an internet special for $20 less. My reservation was adjusted with no hassle. I paid $111 for a room with 2 queen beds and a restaurant-style hot buffet breakfast each day for two adults and two teenagers. Not bad. 2. Staff was very nice, and compensated us for the problem (see below) with no hassles (one night free, free parking for the entire stay). 3. Hotel takes pets. 4. Room was clean, no mysterious stains. BUT 5. The property and the room itself - particularly the bathroom - looked very dated. 6. There was problems with the shower going from hot to cold and back again on it's own; the front desk said that they had had several complaints of that nature. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price in January $76/night & CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: wrldtravelz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights to attend a MCRD(U.S. Marine) graduation. The grounds of the hotel were nice, the room was very clean, & bathrooms were supplied with Bath & Body Works toiletries. We also made use of the Free Business Center to print our return boarding passes for Southwest Airlines. It was free to print our boarding passes, and $10/day for wi-fi access in your hotel room. The double beds were comfortable and there was a decent selection of in-room movies. For the winter rate of only $76/night this hotel was much better than we expected. It was only a 10 minute drive to the MCRD base for the graduation services. Try to get a room overlooking the pool if possible. There is a Target close by for any supplies you may have forgotten, and also many restaurants to choose from in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “great deal on priceline”
Reviews.Author: Dude_Jerry
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Diego with a booking through priceline @@ $70 a night was worried about location and all the negitive reviews I read. I was looking for a hotel on the beach or within walking distance. That would have been a huge disappointment. It truely is a great location for anything to do in San Diego. Didn't think the hotel was run down, unfriendly staff or in need of a remodel. My only problem was the hot tub was a bit too warm the pool a bit too cool. Great hotel just be warned there is a parking fee of $10.00 per night which seems to be the normal on Hotel Circle.

Reviews.Title: “Quality for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Tldodge1001
Reviews.Content: We arrived Monday 10/2 and checked out on 10/4; hotel staff was helpful and friendly. We checked into our hotel room around 4 pm it was 82 degrees in the room, we left to get something to eat and were gone for 2 hours we came back and the room had not cooled down at all. We called the front desk and they moved us to a different room. They had a lot of special parties going on during our stay so the hotel was wall to wall people. Monday night they had a luau outside our hotel room by the pool, kind of annoyed me that they were loud and didn't stop playing music till 10 at night. We ate at the sushi bar around 8 Tuesday night food was great. Hotel is very old, but very well kept. If you are looking for a Ritz Carlton type of hotel it is not, but if you are looking for quality in price I would stay here. If we ever visit this area again I would like to check out other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay at the Red Lion”
Reviews.Author: AVHudnall
Reviews.Content: I selected the Red Lion because it was close to some local attractions. I reserved two rooms at a AAA rate on-line. When we got to the hotel I was given a lower rate and they waived the parking. I checked into one of the reserved rooms and my mom checked into the other reserved room. The gentleman who assisted me was very nice and professional. The young lady who helped my mom was not professional. She could use some lessons in etiquette in checking in guests. She just seemed a little immature. We liked our rooms, the pool and the grounds. We had breakfast at one of the restaurants. The food was just okay, nothing special. We ordered room service one evening. That meal was better. We would stay there again. We would eat breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fun decor and a great value”
Reviews.Author: kellyyfaber
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion Hanalei in San Diego was a fun place to stay! It was an excellent value and the restaurants on site were above average. It was conveniently located on the middle of everything we wanted to see and was very close to the freeway. It was very clean and housekeeping actually refilled the coffeemaker supplies every morning (a rarity with hotels these days). The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the koi ponds are very nicely kept. I would definitely stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: minkymeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. We got checked in around 12pm and got a room overlooking the golf course. The room was a great size and had 2 sink areas one in the bathroom the other outside the bathroom. The room was very clean and within easy access to the elevators. The pool area was very nice and the hotel had a good choice of restaurants - although we only ate breakfast in thePeacock cafe one morning. The hotel lobby is very pleasant and staff were very friendly. Car parking was $10 a night and at times was difficult to find a space close to the access point to the room. The hotel was close to the freeway and Fashion Valley Mall and AMC theatres. We enjoyed our stay at the Red Lion and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room service was good and the room was clean. One of the elevators were not functional and the elevators were slow. (lot of waiting) There was no refregerator available. If it was awailable, then you had to pay for it. The parking was not free, You had to pay $10.00 a night plus tax for parking which they mention that it is secure. I read a sign posted at the parking area that they are not responsible of any damage or breakin of the vehicle and still they mention its secure. There were problems with the drainage of water from the tub. The Iron they provided didnt function normal. The problem with the hotel is they dont have quality control and they dont take care of problems as they should to prevent unsatisfaction. The building is worn out and is not in great shape. parking wasnt enough for all the cars to park. I know that I will not go to Red Lion Hotel anywhere in america because of the experience that I had here. This was the worst Hotel I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Old - needs to be remodeled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property needs to be remodeled. The front desk said we were in the new part of the hotel, but it did not feel like it. The room had a faucet that was constantly dripping water. The bathtub had broken tiles and the needed to be caulked. Front desk was friendly, but said they could not change our room due to they were all booked. Grass in the dog walk area needs to be mowed and cleaned up. For the price that I paid, I was expecting a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Hanalei Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hanalei on our first visit to San Diego. We both loved this hotel. The front desk staff is very helpful--provided us with a great sheet of instuctions on getting around in San Diego. Our room overlooked the pool and was very beautiful. Barely heard the traffic on the freeway. The location of the Hanalei was very convenient. Right between LaJolla and Gaslamp District. The jacuzzi was great. We tried the Sunday Breakfast Brunch at the Islands Restaurant and it was absolutely amazing. The Peacock Cafe had so-so lunches but excellent breakfast omelets. What we disliked was the parking lot---$10.00 per day plus taxes--and the narrowest spots imaginable. We thought the kitschy Hawaiian decor was fun. Beautiful place to stay, and the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “OK, so I like Tikis”
Reviews.Author: 1mermaid
Reviews.Content: I specifically picked this property since my husband and I like the tiki/tropical kind of motif. I would say the hotel met my expectations but did not exceed them. The Red Lion is on a strip of hotels, right off the freeway. Your neighbors are Motel 6 and Holiday Inn so you can understand the caliber of hotels there are in that area. I asked for a room on the quiet side of the hotel. We got a very nice room facing a greenbelt/golf course. It had a small deck and was a pleasant surprise. The service at the hotel is great and everything is very clean. We enjoyed the waterfall, koi ponds and tiki motif bridge. This hotel is very 70s fake tropical - kind of Hawaii only Calilfornia style. If you like that it's a great place to be. I thought it was very centrally located. Just a five minute drive to Sea World or to Old Town. The tropical restaurant in the hotel is fun and the food is good, but not great. Breakfast was the same --- good but not great. I would cetainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I just got back from staying at this property. While it is close to the freeway, it was the perfect location. We were very close to everything, Sea World, the Zoo, Balboa Park, ect. The airport was less then 10 mins away as well. Fashion Valley mall and great resturants are also close. As for the property itself, we really enjoyed it. It is a bit older, but the room was spacious and the service was great. The pool is nice and the outside decor is beautiful. I felt like I was in Hawaii at times. The food was good and the prices were reasonable. Downside: Close to freeway, some noise at times Older property, could use some renovations Upside: GREAT location Spacious rooms with 2 chairs and table and balcony Wonderful service Reasonable rates Nice pool Laundry facilities on site (our son got sick and this was a HUGE help) My family is planning to go back to San Diego next year again and we will for sure stay at the Red Lion again!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: BridgesUKCambridge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. The main problem is it's location. You need a car to get everywhere. The hotel service was very good and friendly. But the conciege service is non existent. The building is a bit tired and sound proofing a little poor. We paid very little for our stay but still felt a little disappointed and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bliss, Hotel NOT a miss”
Reviews.Author: MMischeif
Reviews.Content: I visited every hotel San Diego has to offer and I was very pleased with the choice I made to use this hotel to host my guests for our wedding. A budget-minded hotel for California. The rooms are modest and decor reminicent of the early 80's (think Magnum P.I.) The hightlights of this hotel are the pool area which was great for all to gather around and the lovely waterfall and coy pool areas which served very well for the pre-ceremony photos. The staff was great and the hotel is centrally located for all that San Diego has to offer. If you are looking for an all-inclusive beach type of vacation stay then this is not the place, but if you plan to rest your head, catch a few rays poolside, need to eat and want to travel the town then this hotel is perfect! It sits off a major highway which allows easy access to all attractions. We had vehicles to get around town (they charge for parking as most hotels in town did), but I believe that public transportation is available in the area, if that is the way you must travel-not for me. Wonderful Sunday brunch!!! Inside decor of courtyard gives Hawaiian feel but room/hall walls reminded me of my college dorm-painted cinder block (not bad though). Open and airy courtyard is the center of all room entrances. All in all the hotel was clean, food and drinks were very good from all restaurants and beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: starkt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located a few minutes from the beach, downtown and Balboa Park and -- although near the freeway -- is quiet at night. You can come and go as you please without having to go by the front desk, which is a plus in my book. At night you can drive through the gate without bothering with the parking lot attendant. It is great that they accept pets, and have smoking rooms. My room was large, very comfortably furnished, attractive, with a decent sized balcony overlooking the pool, and with a huge bathroom with marble double vanity. The TV was fine, with a big selection of channels. I had a refrigerator and microwave, the two queen beds were comfortable, and there were additional indoor and outdoor seating areas with comfortable chairs and tables. I had the Sunday brunch and it was excellent -- with crab legs, eggs benedict and a big selection of desserts. The restaurant service was very friendly. Room service was prompt and friendly, and the Reuben sandwich I ordered tasted fine. The front desk was a little impersonal, but this is a big hotel so I expected that. The parking lot had narrow parking spaces, but not to the point of being a problem. I did hear some elevator noise and noise from other rooms -- but I have yet to stay in a hotel that was any quieter on the west coast (construction people apparently don't believe in sound insulation out here.) The pool and hot tub were big and clean. One glassed in elevator didn't work, but there was another elevator nearby that did (I was on the seventh floor). Some people consider the tropical/cinderblock exterior tacky. I consider all tropical decor tacky, so I didn't care. You could spend a lot more money and get less in most areas of coastal California. Don't spend your honeymoon here -- it's not that great -- but if you want a nice, centrally located place to stay for up to four nights, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “strong value for location and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisIndy78
Reviews.Content: Look, if you are looking for a Four Seasons, stay at the Four seasons. This is the hotel that tries hard.The grounds were clean, our room was in the back. Very quiet. You can get a room overlooking a very nice pool and hot tub area but you do run the risk of a little road noise. This would be your best area if you have kids. Our room had a king bed...your standard set up.Never ate at any of restaraunts so I can't comment on that. Great location to the zoo airport<not too close> I-5 NORTH to the North Coast and La Jolla is two minutes away. All in all a great value for comfort and location. The tropical theme is cheesy but so what? If you want Hawaii go to Hawaii. The parking charge of $10.00 per day should be eliminated!

Reviews.Title: “Trashy - Needs Remodeling”
Reviews.Author: MonkeysandTigers
Reviews.Content: Wow, where to begin? This place is so yesterday, it should be mowed down. For the price paid, I expected something better than cinderblock dorm room chic. Hawaiian theme? Lame. The only cafe open during the day had a miserably inadequate menu; the one vegetarian item was a cheese quesadilla appetizer. It's only saving grace is that it's near Fashion Valley shopping. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great Red Lion”
Reviews.Author: jawdmb
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Red Lion Hanalei in beautiful San Diego and although the weather was nice, the property was not. This is more of a motel layout. The outdoor hallways are dark and not well lit, my end of the hall was pitch black. Upon returning to my room everynight I had to wait for the elevator outside, in the dark, by myself. The room itself was pretty minimal and outdated. The linens were old, the appliances were old, and the room had a dark damp feel to it. The bathroom was tiny and the shower was dingy. On the plus side, high speed connection was great and outdoor greenery was beautiful. We ate at the hotel our first morning for the breakfast buffet and it was horrible! We never went back. I highly recommend driving off site for breakfast! Food service was decent but my order was incorrect and I got charged for food I never received. There is ample parking and the pool area is nice too. The desk staff was very helpful and courteous, but the restaurant staff was cold. With all the other hotels in this area I would recommend finding another!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sunday Buffet”
Reviews.Author: vapisala
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend. The staff was very friendly & accomodating to all of our requests. Loved that they tried to add a lil bit of polynesian flavor- we are familiar with the "real" islands (This is a Samoan & Hawaiian family)but it was nice that they made an effort. The sushi bar is great! Islands restaurant for dinner is nothing special- but definately give them a try for Sunday Champagne brunch. Rooms nothing special- but it was clean, no plumbing problems as someone else reported. There was a hint of cigarette odor- but once we opened the balcony doors, it cleared out. People should observe the no smoking signs better! Nice place for the small amount of $ it costs to stay here. We've tried several other hotels in the SD area- but will definately come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “So cheesy - it's great!”
Reviews.Author: gijoolee
Reviews.Content: My husband & I needed a quick spring break getaway, we were stressed out & tired, and I was missing Hawaii really bad (where I'm from but we now live in Portland, OR). I have no idea how we found the Red Lion Hanalei Hotel but it sounded perfect, enough of "Hawaii" to get me through till we would be able to afford a vacation "back home." We didn't realize San Diego would be kind of cold & cloudy during March. Coming from Oregon we thought it would be warmer, but it wasn't & we didn't bring the proper clothing (should have researched the weather better). The hotel itself is like a touristy hotel you'd find in Hawaii, one that would cater to tourists who want to be treated like tourists & only see Hawaii the way it is portrayed in the media (I have no idea why the hotel had Easter Island statues for decoration - what does that have to do with Hawaii?). Initially when you drive up it looks pretty nice but the rooms are really basic as is everything beyond the lobby & restaurant area. Our room was tiny, clean, and older looking. Since the weather wasn't nice enough to really enjoy the pool & we forgot that it was spring break & all the teens would be hogging the hot tub at all hours, we ended up staying in our room most of the time. It was okay though because what we really needed was some R&R & to just get away from Oregon for a bit. We ordered room service every morning - eggs benedict is pretty bad, hollandaise sauce is totally not that. The staff is extremely nice, they have a convenient shuttle van that will take you to nearby shopping and sights, and the best thing was the foo-foo drinks! Just like the real thing in Hawaii! They try really hard so I have to give them credit for that & the place made me smile. I doubt I'd stay there again though because I think I'd rather save up & just go to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pastylady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion in October 05 on our holiday to the USA from England and found this Hotel Great. The bus stop was right outside the Hotel so we caught the Tram into the Old Town and used the different Trams hoping on and off as we wanted to, this is a great service. We also caught the coach to go to Mexico which was a fun day. The staff at the Hotel were very helpful the rooms a good size and clean. The bar staff were very good and Happy Hour was great.The food was very good and the Hotel had a nice size pool which was always cleaned every morning and the Hotel was set in nice grounds. Our room overlooked the pool which I liked and we did not notice any noise from the road. We will use this Hotel again when we next come to San Diego.You do have to pay to park your car $10 a night and just a short walk is a very good Steak House well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hanalei Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with girlfriend and we both loved the hotel. The staff at the front desk were very accomadating. We ate two diffrent nights at the Islands restaurant located inside the hotel and were beyond impressed with the service and the food. Plan on staying the next time I return to San Diego. Also it is very close to the I8 and I5 which makes travel to popular destinations very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Seedy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't take the glass elevator unless you want to be stuck inside for 35 minutes. The property needs updating. It felt like a cheap hotel in Reno. The sliding glass door to the balcony would not budge, the bathroom door was split and needed to be replaceed. Limited TV channels. Everything needs updating and a deep cleaning. Not to mention you have to pay $10 to park your car in the hotel parking lot. Bell staff knowledgeable, Front Desk was helpful. In general, te only reason why this place is rated 3 stars is because they offer massages in your room. There are signs posted everywhere urging you to get a massage in your room. Next time, spend more money and enjoy the comforts of a clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: openskies97
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from an awesome stay at the Red Lion. Everything (but 1 thing) about this hotel was wonderful. The only negative thing I can say is about the breakfast - it was expensive and it tasted horrible. The staff at check in was extremely pleasant and answered all my questions. The landscaping took our breath away. The koi fish ponds were my niece's favorite, the waterfalls (they were EVERYWHERE) were mine. The room was clean, the pool was clean, the hotel was just great. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With the prices of San Diego hotels for the summer months, we were sure that the great price we received on this hotel meant we were going to get a terrible night's sleep or a dirty, small room, or even terrible service, but we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed here with our two year old for a couple of nights for a quick get-away. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although the room may need a little updating (nothing to complain about though!), our room was very comfortable and clean. We ordered room service and the food was delicious and brought within 30 minutes. The baby had a great time in their large pool and the spa was oversized as well. We had a wonderful stay and will definately keep this hotel on our list to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Beds were great but tub didnt want to drain”
Reviews.Author: KidsintowRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: Having a comfortable bed is very important to me so they did well here. The rooms were average size but this was with two queen beds. We had a not so great location perhaps because we had a discounted room through an online travel site. The extra sink outside the bathroom was nice to have. What keeps me from giving them a good review is the fact that there was a problem with the drain. By the end of your shower there was a couple inches of soapy water that took some time to drain so- no taking showers one after the other. We notified them by 10:30 and assumed they would take care of it. WE got back and went straight to bed and the next morning realized it had not been fixed and they never said a thing. They should have told us and moved us if they couldnt fix it. I don't think anyone ever came. We had to leave before 10:30 that morning so it was too late to do anything. I should think the people before us would have had the same problem. Two years ago we were there for 4 days and loved our room up high with a view of a golf course and had not problems. I remembered we enjoyed the pool and grounds but it wasn't the same this time. The pool area is different from the pictures. There is now a white steel fence surrrounding the whole area right up to the concrete and it couldnt have been heated. They did provide towels though. The Peacock restaurant is rather expensive for breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing family setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 days with 2 boys ages 4 and 8. the hotel and grounds are well maintained and layed out for any vacationing family. we liked the choice of casual dining at the peacock or couple setting at the sushi bar. employees all seemed polite and the service was fine. the room was clean and roomy enough for 4. only the ac unit seemed to give the room a damp smell due to the humidity. i expect most places would have the same problem this time of year. would rebook for our next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “loved it, close to everything, will return”
Reviews.Author: krazy4agility
Reviews.Content: Visited here in March 05, chose location because of centralized site to the major tourist spots! it worked out well, our drive to several places was a short drive, no more than 15-20 minutes. which is short for us. dont go here expecting this place to resemble Hawaii though. I should know we are from HI! But I loved this place, relaxing, nice staff, I will definitely return to this hotel on our return. Although the sushi bar is small, we liked the friendly sushi chef, for us in HI the sushi selections reminded us of back home!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, would stay at the Sheraton instead.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but cramped rooms--especially compared to other similar quality, less expensive properties. The must or mold in the room upset my wife's asthma. We were situated near the spa, which is pretty loud late into the evening. The cable TV had some intermittent, but annoying problems with reception too. The food in the Islands restaurant was okay. Beware: parking is $10 extra per day. The positive side is that the hotel accepts large dogs, but for the money and experience I would recommend the nearby Sheraton (which also accepts large dogs).

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again and agaiin!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel for my second visit to San Diego. Not located next to the gas lamp but I know my way around alot better this time. Loved the Polynesian theme, especially since I went with my girlfriend. The glass elevators are a great plus. Safe neighborhood, freeway close.

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion Hotel Stay April 2005”
Reviews.Author: kimmysreview
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice for moderately priced room. I was pleasantly surprised. Room large and clean. Comfortable bed. Ask for a room with a view of something other than a brick wall. Must pay $10 per day to park your car. Spaces in lot are very, very, very tight. Often no spots to park in late at night. Had to create a spot where one did not exist!

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Hotel San Diego - Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 2270 Hotel Circle North, San Diego, CA 92108 (Formerly "Red Lion Hanalei Hotel")
